ovdesc.p: This file is used to record and maintain details of all mutual funds.Comprehensive information relating to each fund along with the conditions applicable to it is stored in this file.

desc.p: Specifies the ID of the Fund Master record. The MF.FUND.MASTER could be created only after setting up SECURITY.MASTER, the ID of both remaining the same. The SECURITY.MASTER should be set up for the fund, treating it as a security in order to maintain and update price details.
Valid SECURITY.MASTER ID
Defines whether error or override needs to be raised when minimum condition as above is not met.
If MIN.INIT.REDM.PRD is specified and this field is left blank,the system would raise override when the condition is not met.
Optional Input. Allowed values are 'ERROR' or 'OVERRIDE'.
Would be defauled to 'OVERRIDE' when left blank and MIN.INIT.REDM.PRD is specified.
Defines whether the fund is a direct fund or a Fund of Fund.
Mandatory Input. Allowed values are 'DIRECT' or 'FOF'

This field identifies the book pertaining to the fund, the value being the ID of the company in which the dealer book portfolio for the fund scheme is set.Incase of a fund management model,this field assumes significance since it enables the System to post profit and loss accounting entries that are raised, to the respective fund books.However the field FUND.GL.REQD in MF.PARAMETER should be set as 'Y' for this to take effect.
For a retail model, the field FUND.BOOK should be input with the ID of the company.
Mandatory Input. Must be a valid COMPANY ID.
The minimum units that needs to be held at any point of time. While redeeming, the system would check the units being redeemed against the current holding to see whether the condition is met.
Optional Input. Standard T24 nominal / amount ( NOMAMT ) format.
Identifies the date when the fund was opened.
This field will be used for validation purposes in the application level in MF.ORDER.BY.CUST, MF.ORDER and MF.TRADE .i.e. Transactions cannot have a trade date / order date prior to this date.
Mandatory Input. Standard T24 Date format.
Defines whether error or override needs to be raised when minimum condition as above is not met.
If MIN.INIT.SUBS is specified and this field is left blank,the system would raise override when the condition is not met.
Optional Input. Allowed values are 'ERROR' or 'OVERRIDE'.
Would be defauled to 'OVERRIDE' when left blank and MIN.INIT.SUBS is specified.
This would specify whether discount, if any, is in terms of percentage or amount
Allowed values are 'PERCENTAGE' or 'AMOUNT'
Fields from TRANS.TYPE to DISC.AMT would be associated multi-value fields and fields from HOLD.PERIOD to DISC.AMT would be associated sub value fields.
Defines minimum number of days to be held before the redemption of this position.
Optional Input. Could be nD, nW, nM or nY where n is the number of calender days, Working days, Months or Years
Defines the minimum amount of subscription if customer already has a holding in the fund.
Optional Input.Standard T24 Amount format
Help Text for this field is unavailable. Please refer to the T24 User Guides for further information.
The account used for investments by the fund. The proceeds from the control account would be transferred to the settlement account from where the investments would be made.
Must be a valid ACCOUNT record
Defines whether error or override needs to be raised when minimum condition as above is not met.
If MIN.HLDG.PERIOD is specified and this field is left blank,the system would raise override when the condition is not met.
Optional Input. Allowed values are 'ERROR' or 'OVERRIDE'.
Would be defauled to 'OVERRIDE' when left blank and MIN.HLDG.PERIOD is specified.
Defines the face value per unit of the fund.
Mandatory Input. Standard T24 Amount format.
The price at inception, i.e. New Fund Offer price
Mandatory Input. Standard T24 Price format.
The account where the subscriptions would be credited to and redemptions would be made from.
Must be a valid ACCOUNT record
Defines whether error or override needs to be raised when minimum condition as above is not met.
Optional Input. Allowed values are 'ERROR' or 'OVERRIDE'.
If MIN.INIT.REDM.PRD is set and this field is null then override would be raised if the above condition is not met.
Name of the trustee to the fund.
Optional Input. Free format text. 1-35 alpha numeric characters.
These are add ons to NAV for determining the subscription/redemption price
Must be a valid FT.COMMISSION.TYPE record
Defines the issue size in terms of amount for the fund and is used for information purpose.
Standard T24 Amount format.

The transaction type for which this charge would be applicable. If ALL is specified, this charge would be applicable for all transaction types, if ALL.CREDIT is specified, this would be applicable for all credit (subscription) transactions, if ALL.DEBIT is specified, this would be applicable for all redemptions. By using different transaction types, it is possible to levy different charges for initial subscription, partial redemptions, full redemptions, switches, etc.
Allowed values are 'ALL' or 'ALL.CREDIT' or 'ALL.DEBIT' or a valid SC.TRANS.NAME record
Mandatory if OTHER.FEES.DESC is specified.
Fields OTHER.FEES.DESC to OTH.FEE.CHG.CDE form a related multi-value set.

The minimum holding period in days, months or years. At the time of redemption, the system would check whether the units being redeemed have been held for the period specified in this field. The system would check against the holdings being allocated towards the redemption
Optional Input.Could be nD, nW, nM or nY where n is the number of calender days, Working days, Months or Years
This is the ID of FT.COMMISSION.TYPE record where fee details are stored.
Must be a valid FT.COMMISSION.TYPE record
Fields OTHER.FEES.DESC to OTH.FEE.CHG.CDE form a related multi-value set.

This is a multi value field to specify the funds to which the holdings in this fund could be switched. The input could either be ALL or Asset type or Sub asset type (fund families) or specific fund Ids. Switch would be allowed only to the funds specified here.
Valdation Rules
Multi-value field.
Allowed values are 'ALL' or 'A-' followed by an ASSET.TYPE or 'S-' followed by a SUB.ASSET.TYPE or a specific MF.FUND.MASTER ID.

Defines whether the Minimum redemption specified is in terms of value or units. If VALUE is defined here and the redemption is in terms of units, the system would convert the units into value terms at order / trade stage based on prevailing NAV and raise override/error as the case may be and vice versa.
Optional Input. Allowed values are 'UNITS' or 'VALUE'
The account from where various expenses and charges related to fund operations are met.
Must be a valid ACCOUNT record

This is applicable only for redemption type transactions where exit load varies based on holding period. If this field is blank, exit load would be same irrespective of holding period. If this field has a value, the charge code given below would be applicable to the holding period specified here. For example, if the field has a value 6M, then all holdings redeemed on or before 6 months from subscriptions would have exit load as defined in the Charge Code field linked to this.
Input allowed only for debit transactions. Accepted values would be nD, nW, nM or nY where n is the number of calender days, Working days, Months or Years. The last value should be left blank.
Fields from TRANS.TYPE to DISC.AMT would be associated multi-value fields and fields from HOLD.PERIOD to DISC.AMT would be associated sub value fields.
This is the description of other fees levied. There could be certain types of fees specific to certain countries/fund companies or funds which could be defined in this field.
1-35 Alpha-numeric characters.
Fields OTHER.FEES.DESC to OTH.FEE.CHG.CDE form a related multi-value set.
Field to determine whether Systematic plans would be allowed for the fund. Systematic plans would not be allowed for funds that do not support systematic plans
Allowed values are 'YES' or 'NO'
Defines whether the fund is open ended or closed ended.
Mandatory Input. Allowed values are 'OPEN-ENDED' or 'CLOSED-ENDED'
These are add ons to NAV for determining the subscription/redemption price
Must be a valid FT.COMMISSION.TYPE record
Defines the minimum initial subscription if any in terms of amount.
Optional Input.Standard T24 Amount format
Defines whether error or override needs to be raised when minimum condition as above is not met.
If MIN.REDEMPTION is specified and this field is left blank,the system would raise override when the condition is not met.
Optional Input. Allowed values are 'ERROR' or 'OVERRIDE'.
Would be defauled to 'OVERRIDE' when left blank and MIN.REDEMPTION is specified.
Address of the Trustee.
Multi-value field. 1-35 alpha numeric characters.
The minimum amount or number of units that could be redeemed at any point of time. If the holdings are less than the minimum specified here, the transaction would be allowed without any checks
Optional Input. Standard T24 nominal / amount ( NOMAMT ) format.
Defines the rounding parameters for subscription, redemption and NAV.
Must be a valid MF.ROUNDING.PARAM id.
Defines whether error or override needs to be raised when minimum condition as above is not met.
If MIN.ENSUING.SUBS is specified and this field is left blank,the system would raise override when the condition is not met.
Optional Input. Allowed values are 'ERROR' or 'OVERRIDE'.
Would be defauled to 'OVERRIDE' when left blank and MIN.ENSUING.SUBS is specified.
Defines whether error or override needs to be raised when minimum condition as above is not met.
If MINIMUM.HOLDING s specified and this field is left blank,the system would raise override when the condition is not met.
Optional Input. Allowed values are 'ERROR' or 'OVERRIDE'.
Would be defauled to 'OVERRIDE' when left blank and MINIMUM.HOLDING is specified.
Date from which NAV would be available.
Validation Rules:.
Should be greater than Start Date of the fund. Standard T24 Date format.
Fund description which will appear on display screens.
As this field is limited to 35 characters only, a concise name,abbreviated where necessary should be included.
This field may be expanded to allow the user to enter the fund description in various languages.
Each expansion of the field will correspond to a new language on the LANGUAGE table and will indicate to the user the language in which the data is to be entered.
This field is to identify whether this is an internal fund.
Optional Input. Allowed values are 'Y' or '' ( null )

Specifies the number of days for settlement. This would be used to arrive the value date of the trade.If no date is specified in the VALUE.DATE field, the system will check this field to arrive at the value date by adding the no of days ( working days ) specified to the DEAL.DATE field in the MF.TRADE application.
3 Numeric characters.

The transaction type for which this charge would be applicable. If ALL is specified, this charge would be applicable for all transaction types, if ALL.CREDIT is specified, this would be applicable for all credit (subscription) transactions, if ALL.DEBIT is specified, this would be applicable for all redemptions. By using different transaction types, it is possible to levy different charges for initial subscription, partial redemptions, full redemptions, switches, etc.
Allowed values are 'ALL' or 'ALL.CREDIT' or 'ALL.DEBIT' or a valid SC.TRANS.NAME record
Fields from TRANS.TYPE to DISC.AMT would be associated multi-value fields and fields from HOLD.PERIOD to DISC.AMT would be associated sub value fields.

Determines whether NAV would be based on historical value or value to be obtained in future. If Historical, already available NAV would be used for allotting units else the units would be allotted only after subsequent NAV is available.
Allowed values are 'FORWARD' or 'HISTORICAL'
This is either discount percentage or amount. If DISC.TYPE is blank, then this would be considered in terms of percentage. The discount would be limited to the extent of fees calculated.
If DISC.TYPE is percentage, this should be 1- 100 ( %) else any numeric character indicating amount. Standard T4 Amount format.
Fields from TRANS.TYPE to DISC.AMT would be associated multi-value fields and fields from HOLD.PERIOD to DISC.AMT would be associated sub value fields.
Identifies the date on which the Initial Subscription closes.
Optional Input. Standard T24 Date format.
Should be greater than START.DATE and less than or equal to NAV.CALC.START.DT
For a CLOSED-ENDED fund, it would default to the CLOSURE.DATE if not entered.
The customer id of the Fund Manager.
Optional Input. Must be a valid CUSTOMER ID
The minimum period before which the holding cannot be redeemed initially.

The minimum redemption period could be specified in days, months or years.At the time of redemption, the system would check whether the units being redeemed have been held for this period from the initial subscription closure date ( field INIT.SUBS.CLOSE.DT).
Optional Input.Could be nD, nW, nM or nY where n is the number of calender days, Working days, Months or Years
Specifies whether fund switch would be allowed out of this fund
Allowed values are 'YES' or 'NO'
Specifies whether unit switch would be allowed out of this fund
Allowed values are 'YES' or 'NO'
This is the ID of FT.COMMISSION.TYPE record where fee details are stored.
Must be a valid FT.COMMISSION.TYPE record
Fields from TRANS.TYPE to DISC.AMT would be associated multi-value fields and fields from HOLD.PERIOD to DISC.AMT would be associated sub value fields.
Identifies the date on which the fund would be closed or was closed.
Optional Input. Standard T24 Date format.
Input mandatory for a CLOSED-ENDED fund.Should be greater than START.DATE.
